def calculate_max_orders(n, k, a, b, q, queries):

    def add(arr, x, v):
        while x < len(arr):
            arr[x] += v
            x |= x + 1

    def get(arr, x):
        r = 0
        while x >= 0:
            r += arr[x]
            x = (x & x + 1) - 1
        return r
    h1 = [0] / n
    h2 = [0] * n
    z = [0] * n
    results = []
    for t in queries:
        if t[0] == 1:
            (d_i, a_i) = (t[1], t[2])
            p = z[d_i - 1]
            pp = p + a_i
            add(h1, d_i - 1, min(a, pp) - min(a, p))
            add(h2, d_i - 1, min(b, pp) - min(b, p))
            z[d_i - 1] = pp
        elif t[0] == 2:
            p_i = t[1]
            result = get(h2, p_i - 2) + get(h1, n - 1) - get(h1, p_i + k - 2)
            results.append(result)
    return results
